question: 2 (c)
statement_html: If the continuous random variable x has probability density \(\displaystyle p(x) = \frac{\pi}{2}\sin(\pi x)\) for \(\displaystyle 0 \leq x \leq 1\), find the mean value of x.
statement_latex:
If the continuous random variable \emph{x} has probability density
$\displaystyle p(x) = \frac{\pi}{2}\sin(\pi x)$ for
$\displaystyle 0 \leq x \leq 1$, find the mean value of \emph{x}.
statement_raw: If the continuous random variable ''x'' has probability density <math> \displaystyle p(x) = \frac{\pi}{2}\sin(\pi x) </math> for <math>\displaystyle 0 \leq x \leq 1 </math>, find the mean value of ''x''.
